intro: Draba zapateri, commonly known as the Zapater's rockcress, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia, particularly in rocky and alpine habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–15 cm, with basal leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with four petals arranged in a cross shape, a characteristic feature of the Brassicaceae family. Draba zapateri is often found in limestone soils and is adapted to harsh, high-altitude environments.
